result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J. Recla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 2-3-16
Pay DNA surcharge to be repaid during probation.
No alcohol, no drugs, no illegal drugs, no prescription drugs - except by prescription and according to doctor's orders.
Comply with all terms and conditions of Marinette County Drug Court.

timeConds.notes:
To be used as a sanction and treatment of Drug Court.
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Def addresses the court

Imposed and stayed: 3 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Eligible for CIP and SAP.
3 years probation:

Comply with all terms and conditions of Marinette County Drug Court
No alcohol, no dugs, no illegal drugs, no prescription drugs- except by prescription and according to doctor's orders
1 year jail with huber release, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations- to be used as a sanction and treatment of Drug Court. 4 days credit.
Def must give DNA sample by 2-3-16
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Appeal rights
